page.title: 08Education - Ponthir School
page.content: Ponthir building is a new building, being built in 1974. It replaces a very old school, still used as a Special Unit, near the church. It is a Controlled Voluntary School and can accommodate 150 children. It now has 75 divided into 3 classes. Rev. K. Beardmoreis, Headteacher, Mr. D. Jenkins, is Deputy, and Mrs. Mason is responsible for Music. We play a lot of sport and each year we have a sports day. We also have music and Mr. Robinson and Mr. Dyer visit us to teach us. We are making a large tapestry for the Domesday Project.
